description: As coronavirus spreads rapidly the Dutch official stance has been criticised as cold-hearted.
title: Coronavirus: Why Dutch lockdown may be a high-risk strategy
title_page: Coronavirus: Why Dutch lockdown may be a high-risk strategy - BBC News
maintext: "We think we're cool-headed," explained Dr Louise van Schaik of the Clingendael Institute of International Relations. "We don't want to overreact, to lock up everybody in their houses. And it's easier to keep the generations apart here, because grandpa and grandma don't live at home with their children."
